cyclone.name: NESTOR
cyclone.category: Tropical Storm (not yet on SSHS scale)
cyclone.current_location: about 155 mi E of Tampico, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating northeastward, expected to cross the northeastern Gulf of Mexico, make landfall along the Florida Panhandle Friday evening, then sweep across GA/SC and exit into the western Atlantic

weather_observation.watch_coast: East of the Ochlockonee River to Yankeetown, FL (Big Bend Gulf coast)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Mouth of Pearl River LA eastward to the MS/AL border and to the Ochlockonee River, FL; also Grand Isle LA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from Louisiana to Florida Panhandle, then inland across Georgia and the Carolinas to the Mid-Atlantic seaboard
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (34 kt) possible Saturday; overall 24 % cumulative risk
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for Jacksonville’s Atlantic coast; surge watch confined to Gulf side of FL
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches with locally higher amounts Saturday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes cannot be ruled out in outer rain bands as system passes
